title: New years resolutions!
content:
What are YOURS?

Mine:

1.) Get that damn possum out of the attic.

2.) Loose that extra weight

3.) Abstain from drinks, at least for a little while

4.) Keen more

5.) Mod more

6.) Give Harvey his soul back

7.) Overcome my addiction to resolutions on public holidays.


A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

[img]http://img.photobucket.com/albums/v410/Gannalev/rcwn.png[/img]

"No one should be here."
-Levellord

title: hmm
content:
This year, 2006, I resolve:

1) To eat more responsibly, keeping conscious track of how many calories I'm eating per day, and to be aware of how active I am relative to that intake. I don't like the way my tummy looks.

2) To be more communicative of my own desires in my relationship. I am not a doormat or whipped, but I do tend to dismiss my own opinions when decisions cause stress in the relationship. Time to speak up.

3) To rediscover what it is about Keen that kept him alive in my soul all these years, to rekindle the enthusiasm for modding I lost 6 months ago, and to conceptualize a Keen4 mod that makes people sit up and smile.

4) To apply myself to my studies at college, with a definite purpose in mind. Classes are not simply going through the motions; they are gateways of opportunity, and I would be a fool to trudge through with my head down.

Good luck in 2006, everyone. :-)[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: hmm
content: I'd select the same than LL's #4 and #5. Other than that, can't say.. I have a bad feeling the year is gonna be lamer than this year. Blah.Eat your veggies!

title: *re-solves*
content:
The things I intend to manifest (and am in the process of doing so) this year:
1) The ability to eat comfortably, without the need to strategise around dodged teeth.

In part this means the removal of as many teeth as possible, preferably all, sometime around Jan 11 [the earliest date at which I'll have access to general anesthetic], along with some form of prosthesis that isn't going to be weird and old-folky, and constant drunkness and numbness of the respective nerves (via Brandy and cloves) until then.

2) Electronics that work without constant tinkering; ie: Brand new computer, 512 or 1500 broadband, and general technological upgrades across the board.

Also opportunities to help other people to achieve technological stability.

3) Stable and dynamic living and working environment(s). "A place for everything and everything in its place."

4) Efficient and regular effort toward and completion of projects. Includes Keen modding/miscellany and game development but covers all manner of things.

5) Improved decisiveness and proactivity.

Hmm... I guess the general theme is stability and cohesiveness. I've lived for too long amongst disorder and unproductive chaos. It's time to change that and create an environment more conductive to my goals. From there all else shall follow.

Happy New Day, Week, Month and Year.

[hr]Xky 3) To rediscover what it is about Keen that kept him alive in my soul all these years
[hr]Amen to that. I think that's something this community as a whole could do well to undertake. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]
